snippet: The F.D.A. is proposing rules that could stop manufacturers from selling a type of artificial hip that is failing early in many patients.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration is proposing rules that could stop manufacturers from selling a type of artificial hip that is failing early in many patients; estimated 500,000 patients in United States have received hip.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. is proposing rules that could stop manufacturers from selling a type of artificial hip that is failing early in many patients.

headline.seo: F.D.A. to Tighten Regulation of All-Metal Hip Implants
headline.main: F.D.A. Seeks to Tighten Regulation of All-Metal Hip Implants
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Seeks to Tighten Regulation of All-Metal Hip Implants
